radiographic_examinations.findings: Osteopenia of the right proximal femur and acetabulum. No evidence of fracture or avascular necrosis.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Follow-up radiograph taken approximately 13 weeks later revealed normal mineralization of the right femur and acetabulum.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Bone marrow edema of the right femoral head, neck, and intertrochanteric region.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Follow-up MRI approximately 15 weeks postpartum showed slight residual high-signal intensity indicating marked reduction of bone marrow edema.
